gr.interamerican.bo2.utils
Class JavaBeanUtils

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.utils.JavaBeanUtils

public class JavaBeanUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Javabean utils offers utilities that use the facilities provided by the Apache commons BeanUtils project.

Constructor Detail

JavaBeanUtils

public JavaBeanUtils()
Method Detail

copyProperties

public static void copyProperties(java.lang.Object source,
                                  java.lang.Object target,
                                  java.lang.String[] properties)
Copies common properties of an object to another. The method will copy all properties of the source object that have their name included in the properties array, to the target object. The property will be copied only if it has the same type in both objects or if the type of the first object's property is assignable to the type of the second object's property. Source and target object don't need to be instances of the same class. If either the source or the target objects are null the method will have no effect on either object.

Parameters:
source - Object who's properties will be copied to the target object.
target - Object to which the properties will be copied.
properties - Names of properties to copy. If this array is empty or null then all properties of source will be copied to the target.

copyProperty

public static void copyProperty(java.lang.Object source,
                                java.lang.Object target,
                                java.beans.PropertyDescriptor sourcePd,
                                java.beans.PropertyDescriptor targetPd)
Copies a property from a source object to a target object given two respective property descriptors. The target's property type has to be a super-type of the source's property type. If both are sub-types of Number, we use a converter to convert the source property to a type compatible with the target property. This may lead to loss of precision. TODO: We could also support other conversions, e.g. Character -> String

Parameters:
source -
target -
sourcePd -
targetPd -

setProperty

public static void setProperty(java.beans.PropertyDescriptor pd,
                               java.lang.Object val,
                               java.lang.Object obj)
Sets the value of a property on an object. If the property has a setter method, then it will be called. If the property does not have a setter method, the field will be set. If there is no such field, then the method will ignore it.
The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
pd - Descriptor of the property.
val - New value for the field.
obj - Object on which the field value is changed.

getProperty

public static java.lang.Object getProperty(java.beans.PropertyDescriptor pd,
                                           java.lang.Object obj)
Gets the value of a property on an object. If the property has a getter method, then it will be called. If the property does not have a getter method, the field will be get. If there is no such field, then a RuntimeException with cause a NoSuchFieldException will be thrown.
The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
pd - Descriptor of the property.
obj - Object on which the property is accessed.
Returns:
Returns the value of this property.

setProperty

public static void setProperty(java.lang.String property,
                               java.lang.Object val,
                               java.lang.Object obj)
Sets the value of a property on an object. If the property has a setter method, then it will be called. If the property does not have a setter method, the field will be set. If there is no such field, then the method will ignore it.
The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
property - Name of the property.
val - New value for the field.
obj - Object on which the field value is changed.

getProperty

public static java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String property,
                                           java.lang.Object obj)
Gets the value of a property on an object. If the property has a getter method, then it will be called. If the property does not have a getter method, the field will be get. If there is no such field, then a RuntimeException with cause a NoSuchFieldException will be thrown.
The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
property - Name of the property.
obj - Object on which the proeprty is accessed.
Returns:
Returns the value of this property.

getNestedProperty

public static java.lang.Object getNestedProperty(java.lang.Object bean,
                                                 java.lang.String propertyExpression)
This utility evaluates a property expression on an object that may be composite, i.e. refer to a property nested in a nested bean. Nested properties are expressed using the "." separator. For example, field1.property1 refers to property1 of property field1. When getting this property something like getField1().getProperty1() is executed.

Parameters:
bean - Object to evaluate the supplied expression on.
propertyExpression - Gets a possibly nested property value based on the supplied expression.
Returns:
Returns the value of the property expression on the object.

getNestedPropertyNullTolerant

public static java.lang.Object getNestedPropertyNullTolerant(java.lang.Object bean,
                                                             java.lang.String propertyExpression)
This utility evaluates a property expression on an object that may be composite, i.e. refer to a property nested in a nested bean. Nested properties are expressed using the "." separator. If an object in the path for the nested property is null, then this method will not throw a NestedNullPointerException. It will return null.

Parameters:
bean - Object to evaluate the supplied expression on.
propertyExpression - Gets a possibly nested property value based on the supplied expression.
Returns:
Returns the value of the property expression on the object.

copyProperty

public static void copyProperty(java.lang.Object source,
                                java.lang.Object target,
                                java.lang.String property)
For a property that is common in two instances, this method will copy the source's property value to the target's property, as long as this is possible.

Parameters:
source - Object who's properties will be copied to the target object.
target - Object to which the properties will be copied.
property - Property name.

getBeansProperties

public static java.beans.PropertyDescriptor[] getBeansProperties(java.lang.Class<?> type)
Finds the properties of a bean.
  • If the bean is a concrete class the properties of the bean, for which there exists a setter method, a getter method or both. Properties of super-types are returned as well.
  • If the bean is an abstract class, an empty array is returned
  • If the bean is an interface, the properties of the bean are returned. The method also queries all super-interfaces and fetches their properties as well.

    • Parameters:
    type - the bean
    Returns:
    Returns the property descriptors of a java bean. TODO: Support properties of abstract classes.

    getBeansPropertiesMap

    public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.beans.PropertyDescriptor> getBeansPropertiesMap(java.lang.Class<?> type)
    Finds the properties of a bean and returns them in a HashMap with the property name as key.

    Parameters:
    type - the bean
    Returns:
    Returns the property descriptors of a java bean.
    See Also:

    Parameters:
    type - the bean
    Returns:
    Returns the property descriptors of a java bean.
    See Also:

    getProperties

    public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getProperties(java.lang.Object obj)
    Gets the values of a bean's properties in a map keyed with the property names. This method transforms a javabean to a map.

    Parameters:
    obj - Java bean to transform to map.
    Returns:
    Returns a map that has an entry for each property of the specified object.

    getPropertyDescriptor

    public static java.beans.PropertyDescriptor getPropertyDescriptor(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                                                  java.lang.String name)
    Finds the property descriptor that describes a property.

    Parameters:
    type - The bean class.
    name - The name of the property searched. This may be a composite property, e.g. "nestedBean.property1".
    Returns:
    Returns the property descriptor that describes the property with the specified name. If there is no property with ths name, then the method returns null.

    setAsMapUsingPropertyAsKey

    public static <K,T> java.util.Map<K,T> setAsMapUsingPropertyAsKey(java.util.Set<T> set,
                                                                  java.beans.PropertyDescriptor property)
    Creates a Map that maps each element of a set with the value of one of its properties as key. There is no guarantee that all elements of the set will be included in the output map. In case more than one items of the set have the same value of the specified property then the last element will replace the previous in the map, as only one item can be associated with one key. If any element has null on the specified property, then it will not be included in the output map.

    Type Parameters:
    K - Type of property used as key. This will be the type of key in the output map.
    T - Type of items.
    Parameters:
    set - Set that contains the elements that will be put on the output map.
    property - Property descriptor specifying the property used to get the key.
    Returns:
    Returns a Map that maps items of the specified set with keys the values of a property.

    getResolver

    public static Resolver getResolver()
    Gets the default Apache commons beanutils resolver utility of Bo2Utils.

    Returns:
    Returns a resolver.

                               java.lang.Object target)

    Parameters:

    target - Object to which the properties will be copied.

    copyFromProperties

    public static void copyFromProperties(java.util.Properties source,
                                      java.lang.Object target)
    Copies all common properties from a map to a target object. For non string properties, the method delegates the bean property setting to the apache commons beanutils (http://commons.apache.org/beanutils/) library. This pauses restriction to the formatting of any non string property in the properties object.
  • dates should be formatted as yyyy-MM-dd
  • decimal numbers must be formatted using as xxx.dd

    • Parameters:
    source - Source properties object.
    target - Object to which the properties will be copied.
